Description: Blue painted pottery shabti of ʿnḫ:s-n-Mwt with a lappet-wig, a modelled face and crossed arms in relief holding two black painted hoes; the front of the leg section is inscribed with black painted Hieroglyphs; the back is decorated with a black painted representation of a seed-basket.
Condition: fair - paint worn, cracked at knee level
Acquisition name: Donated by: Government of the British Protectorate of Egypt
